metadata.title: Tissue samples (and analyses) of subsistence and commercial marine fishes of the eastern Bering Sea (splits of tissue samples to be archived in UAF museum)

creators.name: University of Alaska Fairbanks (UAF), School of Fisheries

metadata.description:
Collected tissue samples from red salmon, chum salmon, silver salmon, king salmon, king crab, species of clam and surficial sediments from the Yukon and Kuskokwim deltas, Norton Sound, Kvichak and Nushagak Rivers, Izembek Lagoon; water samples analyzed for: total mercury methyl mercury, selemium and Omega-3 polyunsaturated fatty acids (selected samples); total organic matter in sediment samples.

This project also includes;

John J. Kelley
An NPMR project
metadata.notes:
Purpose: Data  to investigate concentrations of mercury in subsistence and commercial marine life and their habitat.  Supporting NPMR "Concentrations of Mercury and it's Food Chain and Geochemical Pathways to Selected Commercial and Subsistence Marine Organisms of Eastern Bering Sea.

Status: Planned

Maintenance frequency: Unknown

Access constraints: Requires Contributor's permission until 2003
